articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gunmen from the Palestinian group Hamas took at least 200 hostages and killed about 1,400 people during an Oct. 7 dawn raid carried out from the Gaza Strip on communities and military bases in southern Israel.
articles.title: Hamas hostages: what we know so far

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning author Viet Thanh Nguyen said on Saturday a Jewish organization in New York City canceled a reading he was due to give on Friday without explanation, a day after he said he signed an open letter condemning Israel's "indiscriminate violence" against Palestinians in Gaza.
articles.title: Pulitzer winner who backs Palestinians says talk canceled by NY Jewish institution

articles.author: Aidan Lewis
articles.description: The United Nations is hoping a second convoy of trucks will be sent into Gaza on Sunday under a light inspection system that will allow relief deliveries to scale up into next week, its humanitarian chief said.
articles.title: UN aid chief says second aid convoy for Gaza could lead to sustained relief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: About 100,000 people joined a pro-Palestinian demonstration in central London on Saturday, marching through the British capital to demand an immediate ceasefire in Gaza following the Hamas attack on Israel two weeks ago.
articles.title: About 100,000 protesters join pro-Palestinian march through London

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt is hosting an international conference on Saturday to discuss the escalating war between Israel and the Palestinian group Hamas in Gaza.
articles.title: Cairo Peace Summit on Gaza conflict: who will attend?

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Eric Cox
articles.description: Two newly freed American hostages, a Chicago-area woman and her teenage daughter, were reunited with family inside Israel on Friday as relatives celebrated back home in Illinois, nearly two weeks after Hamas gunmen abducted them and dozens of others near Gaza.
articles.title: Released by Hamas, American mother, daughter reunited with family

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former U.S. Representative Justin Amash said on Friday that several of his relatives had been killed when a Greek Orthodox church in the Gaza Strip was hit overnight by an Israeli air strike.
articles.title: Former U.S. Rep Amash says relatives killed in Gaza church air strike

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to "fight until victory" in Gaza, signaling no pause in his military's bombardment and expected invasion of the enclave after Hamas released two U.S. hostages.
articles.title: Israel vows to 'fight until victory' after Hamas releases two U.S. hostages

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Alicia Kirchner, an elder of Argentina's most powerful political dynasty, recalls with fondness helping build homes, schools and the first hospital in Rio Gallegos, a small city in the country's windswept Patagonian south.
articles.title: In Argentina's icy south, a political dynasty fades and a new power rises

articles.author: Lauren Silva Laughlin
articles.description: Wall Streeters are trying to teach universities a lesson, but may provide them with a broader understanding of economics instead. Billionaire investors Marc Rowan and Bill Ackman are enraged over controversial positions on the Middle East at their respective alma maters, the University of Pennsylvania and Harvard. In doing so, they have drawn attention to the unsavory money-go-round in U.S. higher education and provided an opportunity for the system to become a freer market.
articles.title: Wall Street cues a lesson in Ivory Tower finance
